uncertainties: Clinically apparent liver injury from amoxicillin alone is rare; risk_score reflects intrinsic idiosyncratic liability rather than population incidence.
Biochemical pattern can be hepatocellular or cholestatic; cholestatic cases may be more prolonged (weeks to months) despite eventual recovery.
A key confounder in real-world data is inadvertent exposure to the amoxicillin+clavulanate combination, which is a much more common cause of DILI.
